original_text: One way to enforce this ratio is to use a probabilistic, roulette wheel style lane selection policy. VISSIM, along with most simulation toolkits, offers methods to specify probabilistic routing whereby a defined percentage of vehicles are sent down unique routes. This is a piecewise technique that can be reapplied at various locations around a simulation. While these methods are attractive from a calibration perspective as exact representations of existing statistics can be ensured, the process is an unrealistic one as it assumes that drivers make probabilistic decisions at precise locations. So in this case when a vehicle arrives at a point prior to the weighbridges it is allocated one of the lanes based on the respective probabilities. It turns out that this method leads to significant variations in trip times depending on the initial random number seed, this can be seen in a graphic of the key areas of the simulation for the 2 different runs (Fig. 7). One of the benefits of graphical microsimulation is that the 2D and 3D simulations help the researcher to visualise a new scheme and its potential benefits but also to highlight unrealistic behaviour. Fig. 7 shows the congestion at the decision point for 2 different runs. Using probabilistic routing to enforce correct routing percentages is a clear case of overcalibration affecting simulation brittleness.
original_translation: Una forma de hacer cumplir esta proporción es utilizar una política de selección de carril probabilística, al estilo de una ruleta. VISSIM, al igual que la mayoría de los paquetes de simulación, ofrece métodos para especificar enrutamiento probabilístico, mediante los cuales un porcentaje definido de vehículos se envía por rutas únicas. Esta es una técnica por partes que se puede volver a aplicar en varias ubicaciones alrededor de una simulación. Si bien estos métodos son atractivos desde una perspectiva de calibración, ya que se puede garantizar representaciones exactas de las estadísticas existentes, el proceso es irrealista, ya que asume que los conductores toman decisiones probabilísticas en ubicaciones precisas. Por lo tanto, en este caso, cuando un vehículo llega a un punto antes de las básculas, se le asigna uno de los carriles en función de las probabilidades respectivas. Resulta que este método conlleva variaciones significativas en los tiempos de viaje dependiendo de la semilla inicial de números aleatorios, esto se puede observar en un gráfico de las áreas clave de la simulación para las 2 ejecuciones diferentes (Fig. 7). Uno de los beneficios de la microsimulación gráfica es que las simulaciones en 2D y 3D ayudan al investigador a visualizar un nuevo esquema y sus posibles beneficios, pero también a resaltar comportamientos poco realistas. La Fig. 7 muestra la congestión en el punto de decisión para 2 ejecuciones diferentes. Utilizar enrutamiento probabilístico para hacer cumplir porcentajes de enrutamiento correctos es un claro caso de sobreajuste que afecta la fragilidad de la simulación.

original_annotated_sentences: One way to enforce this ratio is to use a probabilistic, roulette wheel style lane selection policy.

VISSIM, along with most
simulation toolkits
, offers methods to specify probabilistic routing whereby a defined percentage of vehicles are sent down unique routes.
This is a piecewise technique that can be reapplied at various locations around a simulation.

While these methods are attractive from a calibration perspective as exact representations of existing statistics can be ensured, the process is an unrealistic one as it assumes that drivers make probabilistic decisions at precise locations.
So in this case when a vehicle arrives at a point prior to the weighbridges it is allocated one of the lanes based on the respective probabilities.

It turns out that this method leads to significant variations in trip times depending on the initial random number seed, this can be seen in a graphic of the key areas of the simulation for the 2 different runs (Fig. 7).

One of the benefits of graphical microsimulation is that the 2D and 3D simulations help the researcher to visualise a new scheme and its potential benefits but also to highlight unrealistic behaviour.
Fig. 7 shows the congestion at the decision point for 2 different runs.
Using probabilistic routing to enforce correct routing percentages is a clear case of overcalibration affecting simulation brittleness.
